articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Replies to Foreign Heads of State
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Replies to Foreign Heads of State
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent messages to foreign heads of state in reply to their messages sent on the occasion of the first anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The addressees include Bashar Al-Assad, Syrian president, Manuel Siriho N'hamadjo, president of Guinea-Bissau, Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Nigeria, Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo, Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, Ugandan president and Girma Wolde-Giorgis, Ethiopian president.
					
					 He in his messages expressed deep thanks to them for their messages.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative ties with those countries would grow stronger and wished them successes in their work.
					
					 In the meantime, the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China to express thanks for its message.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Thai PM
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Thai PM
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by Thai Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra.
					 It was handed to a DPRK official concerned on Jan. 16.

articles.title: Portuguese President Hopes for Development of Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Portuguese President Hopes for Development of Relations with DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Credentials were presented to Anibal Cavaco Silva, president of Portugal, by DPRK Ambassador to his country Kim Chun Guk on Jan. 14.
					 The president paid high tribute to President Kim Il Sung who devoted his efforts to developing the relations between Portugal and the DPRK.
					
					 He said that many countries pay great attention to the politics pursued by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He hoped that the bilateral relations would grow stronger in all fields.

articles.title: Korean People Will Force Japan to Pay for Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Korean People Will Force Japan to Pay for Its Past Crimes 
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists poisoned Kojong, emperor of the Feudal Joson Dynasty, to death on Jan. 20, 1919. This proves that they are the sworn enemy of the Korean people and cruel murderers who defy international law and human ethics and morality. Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article.
					 Citing concrete facts to prove that they poisoned emperor Kojong, representative of the state sovereignty of the Korean nation, to death and made desperate efforts to cover up this crime, the article goes on:
					
					 A lot of materials on aggression and wars are recorded in history, but it is hard to find such hordes of brigands which set extermination of other nation as a state policy and pursued it so brutally and harshly as the Japanese imperialist aggressors.
					
					 The misfortune and pain the Japanese imperialists inflicted upon the Korean people through their harsh colonial rule are still felt.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the Japanese reactionaries are becoming more desperate in their moves to deny the monstrous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past, far from redeeming them.
					
					 Their reckless actions are aimed to repeat their crime-woven history.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK do not forget this history and are waiting for an opportunity to settle it.
					
					 They will certainly force Japan to redeem all crimes committed by it for centuries including those committed during its more than 40 years of colonial rule period, during the Korean war and heinous hostile acts perpetrated  against the DPRK in the post-war period.
					
					 The DPRK will surely force Japan to pay a thousand-fold price for its unheard-of crimes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges Disbandment of "UN Command"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges Disbandment of "UN Command" 
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Whether the U.S. dissolves the "UN Command" immediately or not is a touchstone showing whether it wants peace and stability in the Asia-Pacific region or seeks the revival of the Cold War, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined commentary.
					 The specter of the Cold War, i.e. "UN Command" is again haunting in the Asia-Pacific region, the biggest hotspot in the world, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is working hard to make the "UN Command" appear a legitimate one but in vain.
					
					 The "UN Command" is a war mechanism the U.S. organized by abusing the UN name for the purpose of hurling armed forces of its allies into the Korean war and exercising the prerogative of command over  them.
					
					 The UN is no longer what used to be in the 1950s when the U.S. could fake up the "UN Command" as it pleased.
					
					 20 years have passed since the DPRK was admitted to the UN as its full member.
					
					 In order to restore the authority and impartiality of the UN it is necessary dissolve the "UN Command" without delay.
					
					 The "UN Command" is a dreg of the times as its disbandment was already declared at the UN General Assembly session.
					
					 Nevertheless, the "UN Command" still exists and is reviving as a war mechanism of multi-national armed forces. It should never be overlooked in view of ensuring the security in the Korean Peninsula and the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Steadfast is the stand of the DPRK government to make a positive contribution to safeguarding the peace and stability in the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia.
					
					 The DPRK will make steady efforts to deter any forms of war till the U.S. makes a right choice.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's North-targeted War Maneuvers under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's North-targeted War Maneuvers under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The 7th Artillery Brigade of the south Korean ground force staged a joint drill in cold winter at the drill ground in Ryonchon County, Kyonggi Province together with the an artillery battalion of the Second Division of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea from Jan. 15 to 17.
					 Minju Joson Sunday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is an adventurous war racket throwing a wet blanket over the aspiration of fellow countrymen for peace and reunification and pushing the situation to an extreme phase.
					
					 It is nothing but a poor excuse that the puppet warmongers described the drill as one for building a mutual cooperation system to cope with the "enemy's provocation", the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is none other than the south Korean warmongers who commit provocations on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that they staged war maneuvers against the DPRK this year. It says:
					
					 The tension on the peninsula is mounting due to their ceaseless war maneuvers against the DPRK this year.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the drill is the first joint one staged by the south Korean puppet army and the U.S. forces in winter.
					
					 This fully revealed the true colors of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors hell-bent on the moves to ignite a war against the north in league with foreign forces with its office drawing to a close.
					
					 The group is working hard to divert elsewhere the people's criticism of it through those war moves.
					
					 But such moves will only precipitate its self-destruction. Provocateurs are bound to meet a miserable end.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Field Tactical Drill in Forefront Area
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage Field Tactical Drill in Forefront Area 
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The 72nd Division of the south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage a field tactical  drill in Koyang, Phaju and Yangju, Kyonggi Province from Jan. 21, according to the Yonhap News of south Korea.
					 The north-targeted drill which will last till Feb. 8 will be involved by huge armed forces and offensive means.
					
					 The ceaseless war maneuvers of the puppet army in forefront areas go to prove that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is making desperate efforts to realize its confrontation ambition at any cost till its doom.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Apology Demanded by S. Korean Environment Organizations
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Apology Demanded by S. Korean Environment Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The Environment Movement Federation and three other organizations of south Korea held a press conference before the "government" building in Seoul on Jan. 18 denouncing traitor Lee Myung Bak, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The assertion of civic and public organizations that the project pushed forward under the pretext of improving four big rivers entailed grave consequences was proved to be true by the results of investigation conducted by the Board of Audit and Inspection, the organizations said.
					
					 This proved that the four big rivers project is a chicanery deceiving the people, they noted, demanding Lee Myung Bak make an apology to the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Labor Movement Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Suppression of Labor Movement Protested
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) --The Emergency Situation Council to Urgently Cope with Layoff, Part-time Jobs and Destruction of Trade Unions in south Korea held a press conference around Kwanghwamun, Seoul on Jan. 17 at which it denounced the puppet authorities for their suppression of the labor movement.
					 At the press conference the organization branded the death of many workers as murders by the regime and capital.
					
					 Enterprise owners, backed by power, are pressurizing those workers affiliated to trade unions, dismissing and suppressing them, the organization charged.
					
					 Even the regime, conservative media and courts are joining in this suppressive campaign, it noted.
					
					 Broad segments of people will turn out in large-scale actions in case the authorities turn down the demand for a halt to the suppression of the labor movement and do not take responsible steps, it warned.

articles.title: S. Korean Nurses Demand Right to Work
articles.content:
S. Korean Nurses Demand Right to Work
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Nurses in Jinju City, South Kyongsang Province in south Korea held a rally in front of the city office on Jan. 16.
					 At the rally speakers accused the city office of clarifying on Dec. 25 last year the stand that it would not separately renew the contract signed with the nurses engaged in taking care of the health of weak people of society.
					
					 Consequently, nurses were driven into street in cold winter for the mere reason that the period for renewing the contract come to an end, they deplored.
					
					 The recent step amounted to an unreasonable layoff, they said, adding they would enter a sit-in strike in protest against this.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression of KCTU Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Fascist Suppression of KCTU Protested 
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions issued a statement on Jan. 17 in protest against the puppet authorities for their fascist suppression of workers.
					 The statement accused the authorities on Jan. 16 of hurling police into an operation to indiscriminately crack down on the workers' sit-in strike demanding a solution to the labor issues including layoff, abolition of part-time jobs and a halt to the destruction of trade unions.
					
					 Through this crackdown they wounded strikers and arrested 8 persons including the head of the organizational department of the Metal Workers' Union, it noted.
					
					 The KCTU can no longer remain an onlooker to the present regime's brutal suppression, it warned, calling for intensified actions against the fascist crackdown upon workers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Foreign Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Nigeria, Democratic Congo, Ethiopia and Russia released statements in support of the New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on Jan. 7 said the New Year Address gave hope and conviction to the Nigerian people.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Korean people would certainly register proud achievements in the struggle for the building of a thriving country, national reunification and global independence in 2013.
					
					 The Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association in a statement on Jan. 8 noted that Kim Jong Un in his first historic New Year Address clarified his steadfast faith and will to bring a reunified thriving country to the Korean people true to the desire and behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It paid highest tribute to Marshal Kim Jong Un who gave fresh conviction and courage not only to the Korean people but to the world progressives through his New Year Address.
					
					 The Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea in a statement on Jan. 10 fully supported the Korean people in their struggle to implement the tasks set forth by Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address, adding: Only victory and glory are always in store for the Korean people.
					
					  The Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia in a statement on Jan. 11 noted that in his New Year Address Kim Jong Un said the driving force for the reunification movement is the entire Korean nation, and nothing is impossible if it achieves firm unity. 
					
					 Whatever trials and difficulties lie in the way of national reunification, the whole Korean nation will build a reunified thriving country without fail on the land of Korea by its concerted efforts, the statement added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Kyrgyz Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Kyrgyz Political Figure
						
 Pyongyang, January 20 (KCNA) -- A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity "Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan and chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, released a statement on Jan. 9 in support of the New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address said that the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung was celebrated with splendor, satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 was successfully launched, fully demonstrating the overall national power of the DPRK and great progress was made in building a thriving country and improving the standard of people's living.
					
					 The new year 2013 is a year of great creations and changes in which a radical turnabout will be effected in the building of a thriving socialist country, Kim Jong Un said, calling upon all the people and service personnel to turn out as one in the gigantic advance for the building of a thriving country.
					
					 He stressed the need to remove confrontation between the north and the south, thoroughly implement the north-south joint declarations and settle the reunification issue by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation in an independent manner.
					
					 The Korean people will make greater achievements in building a thriving socialist country and certainly reunify the country as long as they are under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Hospital Universal Taesongsan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Hospital Universal Taesongsan
						
Pyongyang, 20 de enero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un visito el Hospital Universal Taesongsan que construyen los militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					El hospital con mas de 100 mil metros cuadrados de superficie arquitectonica esta compuesto de 3 edificios y tiene todas las condiciones necesarias al tratamiento y revivificacion de los pacientes.
					
					Tras escuchar las explicaciones frente al plano guia general, el Mariscal se entero en destalles del estado de construccion recorriendo varios puntos del hospital durante mucho tiempo.
					
					En el hall central vio la obra de bellas artes alusiva a la imagen del Dirigente Kim Jong Il con amplia sonrisa y dijo que el Hospital Universal Taesongsan ha podido ser construido por el amor generoso del Dirigente.
					
					Destaco la importancia de construir magnificamente el hospital y acondicionar todos los elementos favorables a la labor medica y al tratamiento de pacientes.
					
					Cuando estuvo en la "Yaknaejunungok" (farmacia) dijo que seria bueno escribir en la placa de identificacion las marcas de lengua oficial internacional junto con las coreanas.
					
					Andando por el pasillo, acentuo la necesidad de colgar en las paredes los materiales visuales que dan los conocimientos medicos de las secciones correspondientes y de poner los bancos.
					
					En las secciones de endoscopio y ensayo, averiguo las caracteristicas de los equipos y el estado de la obra y en la sala de operacion, apunto que seria bueno pegar las chapas finas de resina.
					
					En la sala de tratamiento concentrado, pregunto si se ha establecido el sistema de vigilancia en tiempo real.
					
					Me gusta el uso del espacio de la seccion de cirugia abdominal, dijo y prosiguio que hay que aprovechar bien el espacio segun su uso y caracteristica en la construccion de todos los edificios incluido el hospital y para ese efecto, es necesario hacer bien el diseno y la obra y elevar la exigencia en el control de inauguracion.
					
					Recorriendo varias salas de operacion, averiguo en detalles que estan completamente esterilizadas sin polvos.
					
					En las habitaciones de hospitalizacion elogio que los constructores las han acondicionado bien para que los pacientes no tengan incomodidades.
					
					Senalo que este ano planean edificar en el centro de la capital el hospital infantil, el estomatologico y el centro de recuperacion funcional y anadio que hay que construirlos magnificamente apoyandose en tales buenas experiencias adquiridas en la construccion del Hospital Universal Taesongsan.
					
					Subrayo que al terminar la construccion del hospital deben levantarlos pabellones y plantar muchos arboles para que los pacientes descansaran bien y dieran paseos.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de hacer bien la administracion y gestion del hospital.
					
					Se refirio a que deben elevar mas el nivel de cientifizacion e informatizacion de la rama terapeutica y mejorar la labor de salud publica.
					
					Expreso su satisfaccion por su recorrido por el citado Hospital, dio agradecimiento a la Unidad 462 del EPC participante en la construccion del hospital y prometio que vendria cuando haya terminado la construccion.
					
					En la ocasion le acompanaron Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Pak To Chun, Kim Kyong Ok, Ri Jae Il, Pak Thae Song, Hwang Pyong So, Ma Won Chun, Ho Hwan Chol y Jon Chang Bok.
